abstract: Stories from Outlook, Tehelka and Air & Space
snippet: Stories from Outlook, Tehelka and Air & Space
lead_paragraph: Outlook magazine's issue this week is an anniversary special about India's much discussed youth. In the lead essay, Akash Kapur, who previously wrote the International Herald Tribune's Letter from India, says the youth's "optimism and self-assuredness, their faith in the future, have come to sand, metonymically, for a nation that is itself regularly rates, in surveys and opinion polls, as among the most optimistic and self-assured in the world." The special also includes interesting features about young Indian politicians, journalists, entrepreneurs and the cosmetics business.Tehelka has a story on the plight of residents of Delhi slums who have been evicted to make way for shopping malls, apartments and other new developments. Many of the evicted residents have ended up in worse conditions further away from the city, the piece argues, because local authorities have not made any provision for low-cost housing. One evicted resident tells the magazine: "For the government, we are like cattle who have strayed into their fields uninvited."
